content: How can I help you today?

I’ve been having a lot of trouble sleeping lately, and it’s starting to take a toll on me. I feel like my mind just doesn’t stop racing at night, and I can’t shut it off to get any rest. My partner encouraged me to talk to someone about it, so here I am. I’m skeptical, but I don’t want things to keep going like this.

It sounds like your sleep struggles are really affecting you, and you're feeling the weight of it. It also seems like you're unsure about how talking could help, but you're open to exploring it because you don't want the situation to continue this way. This shows a lot of care for your well-being. Could you tell me more about what you’ve been experiencing at night or how this has impacted your daily life?

At night, my mind just keeps spiraling with thoughts about work and money. I'm really worried about getting fired and not being able to support my family. On top of that, I end up scrolling on my phone, which I know makes it harder to sleep—it’s just a bad cycle I can’t seem to stop. It’s exhausting, and I feel off all day because of it.

It sounds like there's a lot weighing on you—concerns about work, financial pressures, and trying to keep everything together for your family. On top of that, it feels like the nights, instead of bringing rest, have become a time where those worries grow even stronger. Scrolling on your phone might feel like a way to distract yourself, but it seems like you recognize it’s adding to the cycle. It must be hard to feel exhausted as you try to cope with all of this. What keeps you going on tough days like these?

I think what keeps me going is my family. I want to be a good provider for them and give my kids a better life. But at the same time, I can’t help but feel like I’m falling short because this stress is making everything harder. I just want to be there for them without feeling so worn down all the time.

Your love and dedication to your family really stand out. Wanting to give your kids a better life and be there for them shows how much you care, even when you’re dealing with so much stress. It sounds like you’re feeling torn—you’re putting your family first, but the exhaustion makes it harder to fully be present in the way you want. That’s a tough place to be. What do you think could help you feel less worn down or more balanced right now?

Honestly, I don't know. I feel like I'm stuck in this cycle, and I can't seem to figure out how to break free from it. Maybe if I could find a way to stop my mind from racing at night, it would help, but right now, I don't even know where to start.

Feeling stuck in this cycle sounds overwhelming, especially when you’re unsure of how to move forward. It seems like you’re aware that calming your mind at night might be a key to feeling better overall, even if finding that starting point feels challenging right now. The fact that you’re willing to share this and think about possible ways forward is a meaningful step. What’s helped in the past when you’ve dealt with stress or difficulty?

I usually just try to push through or distract myself, but that doesn’t really solve anything. Sometimes I’ll try to focus on the good things in my life, but it’s hard when my worries about work keep creeping back in. It feels like nothing I’ve done so far has really worked.

It sounds like you’ve tried different ways to manage stress, like focusing on the positives or staying busy, but the worries about work seem to have a strong pull that brings you back to those thoughts. It must be frustrating to feel like the things you’ve tried haven’t given you lasting relief. Even though this has been tough, your willingness to keep trying speaks to your resilience. What would it mean for you to find something that actually works to help you rest and feel more at ease?

I think it would mean everything to me. If I could find a way to actually sleep and not feel so stressed all the time, I’d have the energy to be more present for my kids, focus better at work, and just feel like myself again. I just don’t know if that’s possible.

It sounds like being able to sleep well and manage your stress would make a huge difference in so many areas of your life—helping you connect more with your kids, feel steadier at work, and regain that sense of who you are. Even though you’re unsure if this change is within reach, the hope you’ve shared here speaks to how much you value those parts of your life. Is there anything else you’d like to explore about what’s been holding you back or what moving forward might look like?

I think what makes it hard is feeling like I don’t have control over the things stressing me out. Work feels uncertain, and that pressure carries over into everything else. Maybe if I had some kind of plan or way to deal with it, I’d feel less overwhelmed, but honestly, I don’t even know where to start.

It sounds like the uncertainty at work has been a big source of stress for you, and that feeling of not being in control has made it harder to manage the pressure. You mentioned the idea of having a plan—it seems like having even a small step forward could help bring some relief and clarity during times like these. Before thinking about any steps forward, is there anything else on your mind that you’d like to share?
I think I’ve shared everything I can right now. Thank you for talking this through with me. I really appreciate it.
